results.title: Sentinels of silence
results.creator_credit: Manuel Arango, Producciones Concord and Robert Amram
results.brief_description: Depicts aspects of pre-Columbian monumental architecture in Mexico. Provides a basis for a subjective appreciation of early Mesoamerican cultures. Stimulates interest in early American civilisations. Encourages further study of pre-Columbian cultures. Narrated by Orson Welles. (Awards: Academy Award for Best Short Documentary; Academy Award for Best Live Action Short)

results.title: A Scary Time
results.creator_credit: Robert Hughes, Shirley Clarke, Thorold Dickinson and UNICEF
results.brief_description: A powerful emotional plea by the United Nation’s Children Fund, appealing for support from affluent nations using experimental film techniques combining found and improvised footage. The film intercuts footage of American children during their Halloween ‘Trick or Treat’ rounds collecting money for UNICEF with footage of international child hunger. Deals convincingly with the realities of children’s lives in less affluent countries. Music by Peggy Glanville-Hicks.

results.title: Sapphire
results.creator_credit: Basil Relph, Artna and Basil Dearden
results.brief_description: Investigation into the murder of a music student, Sapphire Robbins, leads the detectives along London’s coloured population. Although she passed for white, Sapphire was half Negro, and her dark-skinned brother is one of several suspects. When the detective expose, in all its irrationality, the violent hate that Sapphire managed to arouse, the murderer is driven into a confession. The extract is taken halfway through the film when the police investigation is underway and various people who have known Sapphire Robbins are being questioned. Det Hazard (Nigel Patrick), Det Learoyd (Michael Craig), David Farris (Paul Massie), Mildred Harris (Yvonne Mitchell), Mr Harris (Bernard Miles), Mrs Harris (Olga Lindo), Dr Robbins (Earl Cameron), Paul Slade (Gordon Heath).

results.title: The Blood of the beast = Le sang des betes
results.creator_credit: Paul Le Gros, Forces et Voix de la France and Georges Franju
results.brief_description: Classic documentary on a Paris slaughterhouse by Georges Franju which juxtaposes poetry and realism. Narrated by Jean Painleve and photographed by Marcel Fradetal. Music by Joseph Kosma. WARNING: Very graphic footage of animal slaughter.

results.title: Safe loads
results.creator_credit: Kerry Regan, Max Pepper, Peter Dimond, South Australian Film Corporation and Pepper Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
This 1977 film demonstrates the importance of carrying a load safely on a truck. It details the necessary preparation for a drive, including the kind of load being carried, the stacking, placement and securing of the load. It includes a cameo appearance by American pro golfer Johnny Miller at the beginning, and a narrator speaking directly to the camera. Acknowledging that workers often find instructional videos condescending, the narrator speaks in a casual and familiar tone to appeal to the audience. He discusses the danger of petroleum and corrosive acids carried in tankers and the importance of stacking and securing a load correctly. The film ends with a dramatic re-enactment of experienced, yet careless, workers who secure a dangerous load onto a truck, which eventually explodes.

Produced for Mayne Nickless Limited by the South Australian Film Corporation and Pepper Audio Visual.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Cast: Johnny Miller, Roger Ward, Dave Taylor, Robyn Hamilton, Richard Pepper, Ian Gray, David Hursthouse

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Road to yesterday. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille, Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This is a shortened version with music and commentary of Cecil B. De Mille’s elaborate 1925 romantic drama on the theme of reincarnation. An estranged couple are involved in a disastrous train crash and revert to their former lives in the Middle Ages. The train wreck was a remarkable piece of staging, placing the lives of the leading actors at risk.

results.title: A Road in time
results.creator_credit: Brian Bosisto, Brian Bosisto and Associates, South Australian Film Corporation and John Dick
results.brief_description: With an eye to the energy crisis and environmental issues, this film gives a pictorial history of road-building in South Australia. As such, it also encapsulates the economic and urban development of this State. Contains b&w archival footage. Narrated by John Dick.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Bosisto, Brian Bosisto and Associates, South Australian Film Corporation and John Dick

results.title: Ritual in transfigured time
results.brief_description: An experimental film by Maya Deren illustrating what she describes as a critical metamorphosis, the changing of a widow into a bride. The process is not narrative or dramatic but choreographic. The attempt was to create a dance film, not only out of filmic time and space, as previously achieved in earlier films, but also out of non-dance elements. The dance quality is best expressed in the party scene: the party is treated as a choreographic pattern of movements. The final transformation of the widow in black to the bride in white is achieved by use of negative film, which reverses the values of the positive monotone. Photography by Helen Heyman; Choreography devised by Maya Deren and dancer Frank Westbrook; Principal performers are Rita Christiani and Frank Westbrook. Uncredited appearances by Maya Deren, Anais Nin and Gore Vidal.
